channel.title: Cambridge University "Engineered" new bacterium to produce Stem Cells
channel.description:
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oHg5SJYRHA0]http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/Cambridge/9d/en&rlz=1C1GGLS_en-GBGB351GB351&ei=aDxSS_mCCIL40wSmjfSYBg&sa=X&oi=spell&resnum=0&ct/8460906.stm[/url]
Government scientists involved in medical research at Cambridge University have recently "engineered" a new kind of bacterium. The special bacterium was created from the cell of a disease that kills banana plants: meusdeus. The new bacterium only lives for a day but a large petri dish in the right media can produce enough stem cells to potentially repair a human heart valve.
[url=http://bit.ly/7R6KJO]Image[/url]
